Chelsea will complete a £60m deal for Borussia Dortmund’s Christian Pulisic, according to reports.

The Mail on Sunday claim Pulisic, 20, will join the Bundesliga leaders next summer – although a deal could be announced as early as next month.

While news of the American signing represents good news for the Blues, they may be dealt a major blow by losing one of their highly-rated youngsters.

Callum Hudson-Odoi, 18, continues to be pursued by Bayern Munich – with his current contract set to expire in the summer of 2020.

Pulisic’s arrival will send him further down the pecking order, with his pathway to the first team already blocked.

replies.msg:
Chelsea will complete a £60m deal for Borussia Dortmund’s Christian Pulisic, according to reports.
The Mail on Sunday claim Pulisic, 20, will join the Bundesliga leaders next summer – although a deal could be announced as early as next month.

While news of the American signing represents good news for the Blues, they may be dealt a major blow by losing one of their highly-rated youngsters.

Callum Hudson-Odoi, 18, continues to be pursued by Bayern Munich – with his current contract set to expire in the summer of 2020.

Pulisic’s arrival will send him further down the pecking order, with his pathway to the first team already blocked.

RB Leipzig and Monaco are also keeping tabs on the forward, who if he runs down his contract would be sold for just £2m – owing to UEFA’s minimal compensation rules.

Antonio Rüdiger on the new contract: ”That‘s not the case. I think there is also no need. I still have three-and-a-half years (on my current contract) to go. I like it here, but there is no speaking between me and the club. It is not necessary at the moment.“ #CFC
